noun.description: In form Melampodium: a genus of plants of the family Asteraceae (Compositae), comprising white- or yellow-flowered herbs and subshrubs native to tropical and warm parts of America, especially Mexico; (also melampodium) a plant of this genus, especially M. leucanthum, sometimes grown as an ornamental.

origin: Late 16th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin melampodium, melampodion from Hellenistic Greek μελαμπόδιον from ancient Greek μελαμ- + πόδιον.
